prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Correspondence with Carroll A. Wilson, Accession # 6221-ap, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was transferred from Rare Books on 5 June 1989.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection of Carroll A. Wilson's correspondence discusses purchase of Longfellow editions, variant copies, Lawrance Thompson's proposed biography of Longfellow and Henry Wadsworth Longfellow Dana's opposition to Thompson's project. Correspondents include Henry Wadsworth Longfellow Dana, Manning Hawthorne, Parkman D. Howe, and Lawrance Thompson.

did.unittitle: Letter from [Henry Wadsworth Longfellow] Dana to [Carroll A.] Wilson 28 November 1931

scopecontent.p: [Henry Wadsworth Longfellow] Dana to [Carroll A.] Wilson, writes in great detail about arrangements to purchase a copy of Poems on Slaveryinscribed by the author and several diaries and notebooks, and also about his research concerning a photograph of a dancer of the sixties and seventies.

did.unittitle: Letter from Lawrance Roger Thompson to Carroll A. Wilson 19 June 1933

scopecontent.p: Lawrance Roger Thompson to Carroll A. Wilson, writes concerning his research at the Craigie house on the early life of Longfellow and his intention of doing a more complete biography than that of Samuel L[ongfellow] (published as Young Longfellow), which he claims is opposed by [Henry Wadsworth Longfellow] Dana; his article on two letters concerning an unpublished book by Longfellow; an article concerning the publication of the Spanish Student; and other Longfellow scholarship.

did.unittitle: Letter from Carroll A. Wilson to Parkman D. 16 March 1936

scopecontent.p: Carroll A. Wilson to Parkman D. Howe. Wilson reports that he has the first two issues of Voices [of the Night]and asks Howe to describe his copy to establish if there might not be three variants of Voicesinstead of two, and also asks about his copy of the 1845 edition of Poems.

did.unittitle: Letter from Parkman D. Howe to Carroll A. Wilson 25 March 1936

scopecontent.p: Parkman D. Howe to Carroll A. Wilson. Howe compares various editions of Longfellow's Voices [of the Night]and editions of Poemsin his possession and asks Wilson what he makes out of it all.

did.unittitle: Letter from Manning Hawthorne to Carroll A. Wilson 21 June 1943

scopecontent.p: Manning Hawthorne to Carroll A. Wilson, offers to sell Wilson two more Longfellow items to include in his Longfellow Collection.

did.unittitle: Letter from Manning Hawthorne to Carroll A. Wilson 28 June 1943

scopecontent.p: Manning Hawthorne to Carroll A. Wilson, thanks Wilson for his payment for the Longfellow items and the names of other collectors.

did.unittitle: Letter from Manning Hawthorne to Carroll A. Wilson 12 September 1943

scopecontent.p: Manning Hawthorne to Carroll A. Wilson, offers Wilson his copies of two other Longfellow books, The Seaside and Firesideand Voices of the Night, both inscribed by Longfellow.
